channel.title: Internet Society Opportunities
channel.description: Latest opportunities to get involved with Internet Society initiatives

item.title: Open Letter: Irish Communications (Interception and Lawful Access) Bill
item.description:
This open letter calls on the Irish government to reconsider their plans to undermine end-to-end encryption and calls on the Irish government to change its position on the issue at the EU level. We are looking for organizations, companies, associations, and cybersecurity experts from around the world to sign on and demand that the Irish government protect strong encryption. Please share the call to sign on with your networks.

Date: 2025-10-08

item.title: Input on Submarine Cable Resilience Policy Brief
item.description:
We look to the Internet Society community for comments and feedback on how to make the brief most useful and relevant in your regional contexts.

Type: Consultations & Surveys

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Connectivity

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-10-16

item.title: Co-Creation Session: Designing a Community Hub [Online Trust & Safety]
item.description:
We will work together on designing a Community Hub, exploring how it can serve as a space to strengthen collaboration, knowledge exchange, and support among our communities. During this session: We will review the main goals and opportunities for building a Hub; co-create the design and structure of the hub focusing on its value for our communities; identify next steps to move this idea forward collectively.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Policy, Privacy

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Alumni

Date: 2025-10-15

item.title: Working Session: Internet Society Advocacy Strategy
item.description:
This second working session will focus on Objective 2 of the Internet Society Advocacy Strategy: Promote Affordable, Reliable, and Resilient Access: Create an environment that enables people and communities to connect themselves and promote an Internet that is affordable, reliable, and resilient. We will work together to identify a roadmap and concrete steps for our community to implement Objective 2, with a special focus on developing effective tactics.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Connectivity, How the Internet Works

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-10-01

item.title: Input on Age Verification and Online Safety Policy Brief
item.description:
We look to the Internet Society community for comments and feedback on how to make the brief most useful for policymakers in their region and to ensure the brief sufficiently addresses the risks and potential benefits of age check requirements.

Type: Consultations & Surveys

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Policy, Privacy, Security

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-10-02

item.title: Special Interest Group (SIG) Selection Process Q&A Open House #2
item.description:
SIG topic leadership team provides an overview of the topic, campaigns for support and answers questions regarding their proposals with the Internet Society community.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Community

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Alumni

Date: 2025-10-16

item.title: Internet Society Board Meeting No. 190
item.description:
The Board of Trustees invites the Internet Society community to join public sessions of its meetings as observers. These sessions enable attendees to listen in, but not participate in the discussion. See the agenda for the board meeting to determine which sessions are open to observers. Executive Sessions are closed meetings.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Community

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-09-07

item.title: Join the Global Encryption Coalition
item.description:
Some governments and organizations are pushing to weaken encryption, which would create a dangerous precedent that compromises the security of billions of people worldwide. Actions in one country that undermine encryption threaten all of us. With over 400 members distributed across 103 countries, the Global Encryption Coalition promotes and defends encryption in key countries and multilateral fora where it is under threat. It also supports efforts by companies to offer encrypted services to their users.

Type: Ongoing Opportunities

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Privacy, Security

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: Ongoing

item.title: Protect European digital privacy
item.description:
Take part in a coordinated European effort to stop a new EU proposal that would break end-to-end encryption. Fight Chat Control, a citizen-led initiative, provides resources and support to contact your national governments and media to prevent the passage of this harmful "Chat Control" regulation.

Type: External (Non-ISOC)

Region: Europe

Internet Issue: Privacy, Security

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Alumni

Date: 2025-09-12

item.title: Early Career Fellowship Symposium 2025
item.description:
Join us at the Symposium for our exciting panels grouped around the most pressing Internet challenges we face today. The Fellows will share their amazing projects and their expertise on wider Internet issues, showcasing all they have learned throughout the program and beyond.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Community

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Alumni, Fellows

Date: 2025-09-10

item.title: Special Interest Group (SIG) Selection Process Q&A Open House #1
item.description:
SIG topic leadership team provides an overview of the topic, campaigns for support and answers questions regarding their proposals with the Internet Society community.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Community

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Alumni

Date: 2025-09-25

item.title: WSIS+20 Zero Draft - Open Door Session (10AM UTC)
item.description:
Be ready to join these interactive sessions. Together, we’ll shape the ideas and language we’ll use to defend the Internet and help make our vision a reality. Please circulate this invitation among your chapters and invite your colleagues to register for any of the two sessions. We scheduled them to cover different time zones; please choose the session that better accommodates your schedule.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Internet Governance

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-09-04

item.title: WSIS+20 Zero Draft - Open Door Session (10PM UTC)
item.description:
Be ready to join these interactive sessions. Together, we’ll shape the ideas and language we’ll use to defend the Internet and help make our vision a reality. Please circulate this invitation among your chapters and invite your colleagues to register for any of the two sessions. We scheduled them to cover different time zones; please choose the session that better accommodates your schedule.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Internet Governance

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-09-04

item.title: Working session: Internet Society's Advocacy Strategy
item.description:
Join us for our first working session on the Internet Society's Advocacy Strategy. During this interactive session, we will work together to identify a roadmap and concrete steps for the community to implement Objective 1, with a special focus on developing effective tactics.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Internet Governance

Who can get involved: Individual Members

Date: 2025-09-02

item.title: Beyond the Net Grant Program
item.description:
The Internet Society Foundation’s Beyond the Net Grant Program offers funding to support Internet Society Chapters to implement innovative projects that make a local impact by providing meaningful access to an open, trusted, and globally-connected Internet, as well as strengthening the Chapters’ presence in the surrounding community.

Type: Funding & Support

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Community

Who can get involved: Chapter Leaders

Date: 2025-09-09

item.title: Sustainable Peering Infrastructure Funding Program
item.description:
Funding availability varies based on the needs of the IXP or organization. Grants are available up to USD $70,000, and projects can run for up to 12 months. Eligible funded activities include IXP equipment, reasonable operational, governance, and business development costs, IP transit capacity to promote local CDN cache content distribution, and technical, policy, and best practice capacity-building and workshops.

Type: Funding & Support

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Connectivity

Who can get involved: Chapter Leaders

Date: 2025-09-04

item.title: Serve on the Internet Society Board of Trustees Nominations and Elections Committees
item.description:
The Internet Society requests that the Chapters Advisory Council (ChAC) identify one (1) volunteer to serve on the ISOC Nominations Committee AND one (1) volunteer to serve on the ISOC Elections Committee for the 2025-2026 nominations and elections cycle. Find the volunteer requirements, time commitments, and more details about what each committee’s remit is below.

Type: Urgent: Upcoming Deadlines

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Community

Who can get involved: Chapter Leaders

Date: 2025-08-22

item.title: Fundraising and Financial Sustainability Training Series
item.description:
This training series is designed to support your chapter in exploring new funding options beyond ISOC support, strengthening your financial resilience, and putting in place clear, actionable systems for resource mobilisation.

Type: Funding & Support

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Community

Who can get involved: Chapter Leaders

Date: 2025-08-05

item.title: 2025 Global Encryption Day Grants
item.description:
The 2025 GEC grant applications will be accepted from 5 - 28 August (or until 50 grants have been distributed!). Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis by Internet Society staff. We encourage applicants to apply early as funds will be distributed on a first-come, first-served basis.

Type: Funding & Support

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Security

Who can get involved: Chapter Leaders

Date: 2025-08-21

item.title: Endorse the Internet Society’s Contribution to the WSIS+20 Elements Paper
item.description:
Thank you to those who have already endorsed our written contribution to the WSIS+20 Elements Paper. We have submitted our document to the United Nations and listed the initial endorsers on our website. The opportunity to endorse this contribution will remain open for a few days while we wait for the co-facilitators to release the WSIS+20 Zero Draft, which will be the next document in this process. You can endorse the contribution on behalf of your organization or in your personal capacity.

Type: Urgent: Upcoming Deadlines

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Internet Governance

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni, Internet Pioneers

Date: 2025-08-31

item.title: Internet Society's New Advocacy Strategy – Session 1
item.description:
Learn about our new Advocacy Strategy—a bold, collaborative effort to strengthen our ability to influence the decisions that shape the Internet’s future. Whether you're a long-time advocate or just getting started, your voice and actions matter. Join us to discover how you can play a key role in advancing our shared mission and defending what makes the Internet a force for good.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Policy

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-08-06

item.title: Internet Society's New Advocacy Strategy – Session 2
item.description:
Learn about our new Advocacy Strategy—a bold, collaborative effort to strengthen our ability to influence the decisions that shape the Internet’s future. Whether you're a long-time advocate or just getting started, your voice and actions matter. Join us to discover how you can play a key role in advancing our shared mission and defending what makes the Internet a force for good.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Policy

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-08-07

item.title: Expert Group for a Technology Roadmap on Encryption [European Commission]
item.description:
The European Commission is forming an informal Expert Group to “focus on current and future technical challenges impacting lawful access to digital information in the context of criminal investigations”. It is looking for technically skilled professionals with domain-specific expertise, especially in cybersecurity, telecom, big data analysis, digital forensics, fundamental rights, and data technologies.

Type: Urgent: Upcoming Deadlines

Region: Europe

Internet Issue: Security

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-09-01

item.title: WSIS+20 Five-Point Plan Follow-up: Eight Practical Recommendations
item.description:
With Global Partners Digital (GPD) and a group of cross-stakeholders we have drafted Eight Practical Recommendations for the WSIS review with the aim of presenting tangible recommendations on how the WSIS co-facilitators can facilitate a transparent and inclusive process for the WSIS review.

Type: Urgent: Upcoming Deadlines

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Internet Governance

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members

Date: 2025-07-31

item.title: Community Dialogue: The Evolution of the Internet Governance Forum (IGF)
item.description:
Hear from our community expert, Flávio Wagner from our Brazil Chapter, how the IGF has evolved over its 20 years of existence and join a lively discussion on which role the IGF should play in the future, and how.

Type: Events & Working Sessions

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Internet Governance

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Date: 2025-07-30

item.title: WSIS+20 Working Group
item.description:
Join our WSIS+20 Working Group and help shape the future of our Internet vision and global policy. The WSIS+20 review is a key moment for digital development. Its outcomes will guide future UN action and stakeholder involvement.

Type: Ongoing Opportunities

Region: Global

Internet Issue: Internet Governance

Who can get involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Alumni

Date: Ongoing
